title: (x) credits on movie posters - Univers Ultra Condensed {Yves}
content:
Hi there   
i wanted to know what was the name of the font for the credits at the bottom of the movie posters   
   
i found these examples   
(but i'm not sure which one is the one)   
   
left one: Tall skinny condensed   
   
right one: Univers thin ultra condensed   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015060934im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/43200.gif) ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015060934im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/43201.gif)   
   
or if you have any other (or the exact) suggestion please let me know, thanx

Wow. That was a joke. My idea is/was the same as Mr. Mark Simonson wrote here:   
   
   
BTW, Scully, you won't get much help here looking for "FREE" versions of commercial fonts. Many of the experts here are in the font business (that's how come we know so much about fonts). You might as well go to a bank and ask them if they know anywhere to get counterfeit money.   
   
=================   
   
Oh, well.

Hey, H B M, keep me out of this, willya?! And I _AM_ a nice guy. ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015060934im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/bigsmile.gif)   
   
For your information, Abraham, as a general rule credits at the   
bottom of movie posters usually are set in [Univers Extra Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015060934/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/univers/49-light-ultra-condensed/),   
as a search of the Type Identification Board would've revealed (it's   
always handy to do a [search](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015060934/http:/www.typophile.com/cgibin/search.pl) when you know what you're looking   
for, in this instance [credits on movie posters](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015060934/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/13074.html)).

the smileys don't seem to do their job. Sorry to have startled you! ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015060934im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
A new alternative to Univers Compressed, which you might like, is TypeTrust's [Heroic Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015060934/http:/www.typetrust.com/font/heroiccondensed).

i remember once looking for this font as well. if you want a "free" VERY similar version, [SF Movie Poster](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015060934/http:/www.dafont.com/sf-movie-poster.font) should do the trick.

yes, i'm aware the topic was from quite a while ago.
